techBaron.name: Jean
techBaron.text: I am a journalist for Investigate Paris.

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
techBaron.text: Magnifique! Bonjour, my friend.

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
techBaron.text: Pardon, could you please stop poking my nose with your dictaphone?

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
techBaron.text: How can I help you?

techBaron.name: Assistant 'Tonio
techBaron.text: Oui, how can Monsieur help you?

techBaron.name: Jean
techBaron.text: I have a few questions for you. What can you tell me about your new project?

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
techBaron.text: Ah, you heard about my plans for the Louvre?

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
techBaron.text: They just finished that ugly glass pyramid this year—and for what? So tourists can stare at some old paintings we Parisians don’t even care about. Fichtre!

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
techBaron.text: Ah, you heard about my plans for the Louvre?

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
techBaron.text: They just finished that ugly glass pyramid this year—and for what? So tourists can stare at some old paintings we Parisians don’t even care about. Fichtre!

techBaron.name: Assistant 'Tonio
techBaron.text: Fichtre!

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
techBaron.text: If you ask me, we should give the people of Paris something they would truly benefit from: a beautiful skyscraper.

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
techBaron.text: With bright neon-colored signs on top, illuminating my name across the night sky.

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
techBaron.text: And of course, a spot to land my helicopter. I mean—wouldn’t everyone benefit from that?

techBaron.name: Assistant 'Tonio
techBaron.text: Magnifique!

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque - Baron de la tech
techBaron.text: It will be très modern, très chic

techBaron.name: Jean
techBaron.text: I—uh—is there anything else you want to tell our readers?

techBaron.name: Bernad Arnaque
techBaron.text: Liberté, Égalité, more monéy!

techBaron.name: Assistant 'Tonio
techBaron.text: Magnifique! Magnifique! Magnifique!

techBaron.name: Jean
Jean
techBaron.text: Thank you for your precious time, Monsieur Arnaque!

priest.name: Jean
priest.text: Good afternoon, Father. I'm Jean, a journalist. I’m researching why culture is so important to people. Could I ask you a few questions?

priest.name: Priest
priest.text: Of course, Jean. Notre-Dame itself stands as a symbol of our shared culture. What would you like to know?

priest.name: Jean
priest.text: Many people talk about culture as if it’s something we must protect. Why do you think that is?

priest.name: Priest
priest.text: Culture carries our memories, our identity, and our hopes. Without it, we lose the stories that tell us who we are.

priest.name: Jean
priest.text: So it connects people across generations?

priest.name: Priest
priest.text: Exactly. Culture is a bridge between past and present. It reminds us that we belong to something larger than ourselves.

priest.name: Jean
priest.text: Thank you, Father. That’s exactly the kind of insight I was looking for.

priest.name: Priest
priest.text: Anytime, Jean. May your article inspire others to cherish what we share.
